lead_paragraph: Ryan Hall, who won the United States men’s Olympic marathon trial in November, and Dan Browne, a 2004 Olympian in the marathon, joined the field for Saturday’s United States cross-country championships in San Diego. The first nine finishers in the men’s 12-kilometer race will qualify for the world championships March 30 in Scotland. But if the 25-year-old Hall qualifies, he said he was unlikely to go.In a telephone call from his training base in Big Bear Lake, Calif., to the New York Track Writers Association, he said, “I don’t think I would go because I don’t think it would fit into my buildup.”The buildup is for the London Marathon on April 13. Last April, Hall ran London in 2 hours 8 minutes 24 seconds, the fastest marathon debut ever by an American. In November, he ran 2:09:02 over a more difficult course in the Olympic trials in Central Park. He said he was pleased to become one of the world’s elite runners. “The Olympic trials were the highlight of my career so far, and I’m happy to be able to enjoy it,” he said. “It really opened up my mind to what I could do.”.
